data.text: For thine incorruptible spirit is in all things.
Wherefore thou convictest by little and little them that Gr. fall aside.  fall from the right way,
For verily the old inhabitants of thy holy land,
Hating them  because they practised detestable works of enchantments and unholy rites
(Merciless slaughters of children,
Confederates in an impious fellowship,
That the land which in thy sight is most precious of all lands
Nevertheless even these thou didst spare as being  men,
Not that thou wast unable to subdue the ungodly under the hand of the righteous in battle,
But judging them by little and little thou gavest them a place of repentance,
For they were a seed accursed from the beginning:
For who shall say, What hast thou done?
For neither is there any God beside thee that careth for all,
Neither shall king or prince be able to look thee in the face to plead  for those whom thou hast punished.
But being righteous thou rulest all things righteously,
For thy strength is the beginning of righteousness,
For when men believe not that thou art perfect in power, thou shewest thy strength,
But thou, being sovereign over thy  strength, judgest in gentleness,
But thou didst teach thy people by such works as these,
For if on them that were enemies of thy Or, children  servants and due to death
With how great carefulness didst thou judge thy sons,
While therefore thou dost chasten us, thou scourgest our enemies ten thousand times more,
Wherefore also the unrighteous that lived in folly of life
For verily they went astray very far Or, even beyond  in the ways of error,
Therefore, as unto unreasoning children, thou didst send thy judgement to mock them.
